column4: i'm having trouble getting X server to work on the live CD of Ubuntu 7.04 (PPC). i tried using "r128" as the driver for my ati rage crap thing but X immediately quits. other configurations result in a blank screen.
Have you tried starting X with no config?
had no idea that was possible. what is the command for that?
I presume "X -config /dev/null" would do the trick
